result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $200 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or _X_ Random Drug Testing.
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 6/21/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Guy Cardamone.  Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Argument by Defn. Argument by State. CT refers Defn to DCPS w/ random UA. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
